title: What are the differences between a DAW & a VST and what are some good examples of these softwares? - Quora

response.answer_text: A DAW is the platform on which you build your track. Think of it like the operating software of your computer. It’s the environment everything happens within. Good examples are : FL StudioAbletonLogicA vst is an application within your DAW that helps you perform a specialist task. It could be a synth for sound creation, a compressor for mixing or more! Think of it like a desktop application within your operating software, like safari. Good examples are: Serum (synthesiser)Kick 2 (Drum synthesiser)Valhalla Vintage Verb (reverb box)

I have an application called Reaper. It is a DAW — Digital Audio Workstation. When I boot up Reaper, I can chose to access various plug-ins I have downloaded over the years. One of them is FreeEQ, a cute little three-band EQ from Eric Sounds. That one is a VST — Virtual Studio Technology, a format for audio plug-ins. Reaper will also host AU (Audio Unit), JS, Rewire, and several other kinds of plug-in. Among the VST I have is the Aria VSTi. That little “i” stands for “Instrument,” and the Aria Player is a Virtual Instrument; a sampler player that itself hosts compatible libraries. In this case, three of the orchestral and band instrument libraries made by Garritan.
